Welcome to Boot Camp!
Be sure to register on our website http://www.aardwolfboot.com
Also join us on Discord: https://discord.gg/GCjHxxZ
and Aardwolf's Discord channel https://discord.gg/KH62U8P
Don't forget our clan skills:
mutare (double / half the weight of an item) 
napalm (str and int buff) 
Always read your notes on the Personal Board, as well as Announce and Mudinfo.

Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

On a Dull Forest Trail
  Everywhere you look all you can see are trees, trees, more trees, a small
tree, a big tree, a once living tree.  Everywhere are trees of all types and
sizes.  It is really dull here...  Oh, wait, is that a wooden door hidden by
vines and shrubbery?

The Lobby of the Bonded Guildbase (G)
  For what is essentially a waiting room, this one really isn't too bad. 
It's clean, with torches casting a soft light easy on the eyes.  The wooden
walls have been painted a blue any sky would be proud to wear, so nice and
soothing.  A few tiny trees in ebony tubs occupy the corners, while
individual cushioned chairs are provided for visitors to rest after their
long journey to the Bonded Guild.  Books stand neatly on glass-topped
endtables to entertain as well.  Over it all presides a pretty receptionist
who always manages to remain polite but firm.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) east (south) (west) ]

 tour the Bonded Guild and wander the grounds as you like."

The Lobby of the Bonded Guildbase (G)
  For what is essentially a waiting room, this one really isn't too bad. 
It's clean, with torches casting a soft light easy on the eyes.  The wooden
walls have been painted a blue any sky would be proud to wear, so nice and
soothing.  A few tiny trees in ebony tubs occupy the corners, while
individual cushioned chairs are provided for visitors to rest after their
long journey to the Bonded Guild.  Books stand neatly on glass-topped
endtables to entertain as well.  Over it all presides a pretty receptionist
who always manages to remain polite but firm.

A Short Hallway
  The hallway is rather quiet, without a soul to be seen here.  It's large
enough that three people can walk through it abreast, a torch sconce on the
walls every ten feet or so.  It's more plain than the lobby, the wooden
walls unpainted.  A thin dirt-brown carpet does line the floor in
consideration of weary, aching feet.  

<MAPEND>

The Training Field (1239)

The Training Field (1238)

The Training Field (1237)

The Training Field (1236)

A Grassy Path
  Old trees tower high overhead on either side of this wide path, leaning
in to form a leafy canopy overhead.  Sunlight filtering through dapples the
grass, and warms the air just enough to be comfortable without causing
sweat.  It's a rather pleasant environment marred only by the panicked
screams of animals coming from beyond the wooden fence to the north.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) south ]

>>
A Rolling Meadow (1234)

A Rolling Meadow
  This little meadow nestles within the semicircle of mountain to the west
and the north, which makes it a lot easier to keep livestock contained and
makes for less worries about fence repair.  Horses and cattle are both kept
here, meals on the hoof for dragons and humans alike.  The surroundings are
rather pleasant, with lush grass, sheltering oaks, and a small stream that
sings like crystal, but there's a strong atmosphere of tension here.  These
animals know their purpose.  

<MAPEND>

e
A Rolling Meadow
  This little meadow nestles within the semicircle of mountain to the west
and the north, which makes it a lot easier to keep livestock contained and
makes for less worries about fence repair.  Horses and cattle are both kept
here, meals on the hoof for dragons and humans alike.  The surroundings are
rather pleasant, with lush grass, sheltering oaks, and a small stream that
sings like crystal, but there's a strong atmosphere of tension here.  These
animals know their purpose.  

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Center of the Camp
  You have reached the elvish camp at last! Several small fires are scattered 
here, and elvish women tend to meat roasting over these fire pits. Brothers 
and comrades talk of past battles to keep their homes and families free from 
tyranny and despotism. The mood in this camp is somber yet friendly. A few 
smile at you as you enter.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Approaching the Dread Tower
  As you exit the forest and begin approaching the tower, the shadows move
around you in what appear to be fingers clawing at your person.  You realize
something powerful and evil lives here.  The tower is by far the tallest
thing you have ever seen, and as you approach you notice that it isn't
resting on the bloodstained earth, but rather hovering above it.  What kind
of being could have such power to do this?

Guard Room
  As you enter this guardroom, you notice the guards on this side are not
quite as tidy as their brothers.  There is a small mess over in the corner,
which appears to be rags used to polish their weapons.  Despite the pile of
rags, the guards' armor and weapons still look like they have not seen a
good cleaning in years.  At the far end of the room there is a table with
the remains of their last meal, and a deck of cards.  From the look of these
guards and their brothers in the other room, their master is more than
generous in his treatment of his henchmen.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Barren Field (1219)

Crumbling Field
  This field is slowly crumbling into the rushing river to the east. As you 
watch, more and more of the unprotected shoreline ripples away into the 
thunderous water. To the northwest, a small forest broods over the fields all
around it. Somewhere eastwards, a small trail collapses into what has become 
known as Kettermoor Crick: the fishy river leading into what is known as 
Mesolar's melting pot of debauchery. One may merely cross the Kettermoor to 
enter Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west other ]

4519/5094 HP  4509/5527 MP  1218/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Crumbling Field (NESW*)
>>
On the Crickbridge Road
  It was a dark and stormy night...

  There's a saying out in the darker parts of the country that, for a man
in the right kinds of trouble, all roads lead to Fellchantry. They say that
when "No Fear" Narlfryd, the famed Wolfen daredevil, needed a place to lay
low, he came to Fellchantry and knifed a guy over a card game. The story
goes that he wanted to use a vacation in a cell as a chance to let a bad
storm blow over. The authorities didn't give him the chance. They took one
look at that body, shook their heads, and walked the other way. Fellchantry
is just that kind of place. Around here, they're ALL dark and stormy nights,
and the residents like it that way just fine.

  To the east lies the bridge over Kettermoor Crick, the deceptively named
fast-running river that supplies Fellchantry with its ne'erending supply of
fish, trade taxes, and surly attitudes.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]

The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick (1240)

Fellchantry Square (1239)

The Heart of the Mystery (1238)

One of Fellchantry's Justiciars can be seen kneeling next to a corpse.
Magister Liam beckons for you to follow.
Magister Liam says, "Hark!  Come hither, I require aid."
Magister Liam asks, "This is Juilus Sannar, our good baron's silversmith. 
 While our justiciars sweep the square, would you deliver a message for
 me?"
Fellchantry Square (1237)

Fellchantry Square (1236)

Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
A large bouncer checks to ensure that no unscrupulous folk approach the alleys.
A large bouncer grips you by your collar and britches, tossing you out onto the cobblestones!
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

4609/5094 HP  4676/5527 MP  1240/1240 mv  76tnl

>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.

  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened

Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more

There is a loud scream and a flare of light shoots towards the sky.
Below the flare, you hear Belkas scream 'HEAR ME, FOR I HAVE CONQUERED!'
As the light fades you realize a new superhero has been born.
For the next 15 minutes experience is doubled in honor of the new superhero.

You return to the living world.

You see the white moon rising in the west.

deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

4795/5094 HP  5022/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)

4795/5094 HP  4847/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
s
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
A large bouncer checks to ensure that no unscrupulous folk approach the alleys.
A large bouncer grips you by your collar and britches, tossing you out onto the cobblestones!
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

4795/5094 HP  4847/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>


n
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.

4827/5094 HP  4947/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
w
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.
One of Fellchantry's Justiciars can be seen kneeling next to a corpse.
Magister Liam beckons for you to follow.
Magister Liam says, "Hark!  Come hither, I require aid."
Magister Liam asks, "This is Juilus Sannar, our good baron's silversmith. 
 While our justiciars sweep the square, would you deliver a message for
 me?"

4827/5094 HP  4947/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
w
n
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

4827/5094 HP  4947/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  The presence of the barony's courthouse to the north does nothing to curb
the traffic of the usual ne'er-do-wells and cutthroats here. For the majority
of the Justiciars-- Fellchantry's city guards-- the pay just isn't good
enough to really make an effort. The occasional drunk gets roughed up, and
a murderer may even be arrested if he's a little too indiscrete, but in the
end it's just keeping up appearances. Who cares about a murder when no one
misses the deceased? Besides, everyone in Fellchantry is guilty of something.

  Justice waits to the north, longing for someone to avenge the slander done
to her name. The square looms predatorily to the east and south.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

4827/5094 HP  4947/5527 MP  1236/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Justiciar Headquarters
  This aged building, remarkable only in that it's slightly less run down than
the structures around it, is home to His Majesty's Justiciars. From here
Fellchantry's city guards work hard at the appearance of upholding justice.
In reality the guards are only about two steps removed from being criminals
themselves, and the sour reek of tobacco, alcohol, and sweat on the air says
much about the Justiciars' efficacy. Still, the Baron's coat of arms hangs
large on the wall, and that's all the legitimacy these men need.

  His Majesty's Kangaroo Court is in the western wing of the courthouse. To
the south wait the pickpockets and cutpurses of Fellchantry Square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
(Invis) (Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.
(Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.
One of the barony's detectives lounges on a chair with his feet in the air.

Lv 164  G 560372 | Justiciar Headquarters (SW)

There is no shopkeeper here.

Suddenly it's quiet... A little TOO quiet...

n
Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

4877/5094 HP  5009/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (ESW)
>>
e
Baron's Beerhouse
    Lauded as the place to be in Fellchantry, the ironically named "Baron's 
Beerhouse" (most likely never visited by the Baron himself, if rumor is to be
believed) houses a massive selection of tables, chairs, sounds, smells and 
people. The walls are adorned with basic decor and sconces which have long 
since been coated by wax from dripping candles, then coated again and never
cleaned. Smoke hangs in the air as thick as the noise generated by the 
milling of bodies and full-bellied laughter.

To the west, double-doors lead back out into the square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east west ]
(Golden Aura) Who would have thought that scales could flush?  This Lizardman must be toasted.

(Red Aura) A man in a cloak purses his lips and watches the door.

e
n
Baron's Beerhouse
  Perhaps the busiest corner of the beerhouse, this area has a seating 
arrangement in the form of booths which line the eastern and southern edges 
of the area. A preferred space, no doubt, as these seats appear to be 
permanently occupied by those who would use line of sight to the western 
doors to their advantage. Some call it anxiety, yet others may suggest that 
it is mere precaution given the nature of work conducted in the Barony.

<MAPEND>

4877/5094 HP  5009/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Baron's Beerhouse (NW)
>>
Baron's Beerhouse
  A lofty corner, the great bar of the Baron's Beerhouse runs in a large L 
across the northern and eastern wall, eventually terminating in a small door 
which swings this way and that as bartenders move their way in and out to 
serve the establishment's patrons. Many of the more relaxed, or perhaps 
careless, folk sit here with their backs to the door at the bar's edge, 
jokingly referred to as the "maintenance team" for keeping the taps flowing 
and the kegs empty as payment. Laughter rolls through the air of the 
beerhouse, almost as if trapped in permanent festivity.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
(Golden Aura) This barmaid spends more of her time flirting than serving.
(Red Aura) (Angry) A rowdy ruffian laughs and throws another punch.
(Golden Aura) Who would have thought that scales could flush?  This Lizardman must be toasted.
(Red Aura) A man in a cloak purses his lips and watches the door.
Toram, the muscular Lizardman barkeep, stands behind the counter, cleaning out a glass.

>>
Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel gives you a mighty kick, sending you flying away from the bridge!
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.

4877/5094 HP  5009/5527 MP  1231/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
w
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

INFO: New post #507209 in forum Personal from Mandibular Subj: promotion request

n
Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**]
    The signature smell of Fellchantry (jokingly referred to as "Kettermoor
Cologne") wafts in with particular potency from the west, hinting at
the docks to be found in that direction. The aroma, not so much unpleasant
as it is unusual, has strong fishy accents punctuated with less-identifiable
effluvia. Fishmongers exhort the crowds with carny-like shouts, each
extolling the freshness and superiority of their particular wares. The
occasional prostitute wanders through, on their way to providing the
services of Andolor's oldest profession to the dock crowd.
 
  Fellchantry's docks lie to the west, offering an escape from the square.
Farther east an unusually lively building boasts signs claiming the coldest
beer in the Barony.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

4916/5094 HP  5074/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
[**> PK <**] >>
n
A Cramped Alleyway
  This particular alleyway - unlike many of the others in which the denizens of
Fellchantry conduct their lucrative business - finds itself oddly quiet.
Mayhaps it be that Fellchantry Square itself is the central hustle of the 
settlement, paving the way towards bars, men or women for hire and narrow 
passages offering an escape from day-to-day struggles. Mayhaps, in fact, it 
be that there is actually clean and running water trickling away to the 
north; one could surmise that the town's aversion to anything not coming out 
of a bar keeps stragglers at bay.

<MAPEND>

Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>

4916/5094 HP  5074/5527 MP  1234/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | A Cramped Alleyway (NS)
>>
The Aqueduct
  One may find themselves hard pressed to believe that Fellchantry would have 
any running water save for that of Kettermoor Crick. Nay, not for any reason 
of trade or surly attitudes but for a scent that clings to the air. The stink
of unwashed bodies and alcohol-laden belches may be quite the most telling 
when pondering the aqueduct's purpose - the conclusion anyone would come to 
is that it has none. It could be placed in the running for Andolor's cleanest
water supply if it were not for the disrepair in which the stonework finds 
itself. 
 
Eastwards and west, the aqueduct narrows and terminates within the 
bowels of high grey stone walls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

4916/5094 HP  5074/5527 MP  1233/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | The Aqueduct (ESW)
>>
e
The Aqueduct
  On occasion the odd wilted sheaf of lettuce would drift its way from the 
small grate in the eastern wall towards the west, sailing through the 
aqueduct like a small organic mercantile ship. On another occasion, a bubble 
would be belched upwards from the shallow aqueduct underfoot to release the 
signature whiff of stale ale into the air. To the southwest the bustle and 
loud cries of mongers peddling their wares can be heard eminating from 
Fellchantry Square.

<MAPEND>

w
The Aqueduct
  If you were to close one eye, tilt your head a bit, and then close your other
eye, you might be able to suss out some details past the first inches of the 
hardly-opaque waters which stream underfoot from the east towards a grate in 
the western wall, eventually plummeting away into darkness. No doubt it leads
to Kettermoor Crick; a wasteful supply, at that. It doesn't smell nearly as 
bad here as it does when one enters Fellchantry's spiked maw to the 
southwest. Alas, silence itself is also quite the rare commodity among the 
ramshackle stone buildings which make up the settlement; one would not need 
to strain their ears to hear the rattling of bars and enraged yells beyond 
the cramped windows in the southern wall.

<MAPEND>

run nwn
Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**] (1239)

Fellchantry Square (1238)

Justiciar Headquarters
  This aged building, remarkable only in that it's slightly less run down than
the structures around it, is home to His Majesty's Justiciars. From here
Fellchantry's city guards work hard at the appearance of upholding justice.
In reality the guards are only about two steps removed from being criminals
themselves, and the sour reek of tobacco, alcohol, and sweat on the air says
much about the Justiciars' efficacy. Still, the Baron's coat of arms hangs
large on the wall, and that's all the legitimacy these men need.

  His Majesty's Kangaroo Court is in the western wing of the courthouse. To
the south wait the pickpockets and cutpurses of Fellchantry Square.

<MAPEND>

One of the barony's detectives lounges on a chair with his feet in the air.
You must have said something interesting, Detective Bane Jones just perked up.

QUEST: You may now quest again.

read notes
The sheaf of notes has no writing upon it at this time.

You seem to recall Detective Bane Jones suggesting that you
visit the General Store for more clues as to Juilus' death.

Fellchantry Square (1239)

Fellchantry Square (1238)

Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) ]
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NE[S])
>>
You open the door.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
An older gentleman in fine dress tends to the many curios in the shop.

The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

say Juilus Sannar
You say 'Juilus Sannar'
Mister Goodwin says, "Ah, a good fellow that.  I had some conjecture as to
 the ruckus beyond my door, though there are two types of business."
Mister Goodwin smirks.
Mister Goodwin says, "Their problems and mine.  An invaluable philosophy
 to have in Fellchantry, though it appears I have failed by postulating
 that you were aware of the fact."
Mister Goodwin says, "I digress, I shall indulge your inquisitive
 nature."
Mister Goodwin says, "The boy was a bit of a zounderkite, though had
 heart.  He was drawn to an heirloom, rooted deeply in the barony's
 history."
Mister Goodwin says, "A jeweled egg, intended as a gift to his inamorata. 
 I believe her name is... Marceline, yes.  Quiz her on its whereabouts."
Mister Goodwin says, "You may deduce that the egg itself's very existence
 is the source of much contention, though none had thought to inquire
 whether I had possession of it."
Mister Goodwin shrugs helplessly.
After attaining information from Mister Goodwin, you jot it down in your notes.
You have Mister Goodwin sign the statement as true.
You receive a [ Sheaf of Notes ] from Mister Goodwin.

>>
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
e
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) (west) ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E][W])

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1234/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1233/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
e
s
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1232/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1231/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) Peddling his wares, this man waves you over.
(Red Aura) Peddling his wares, this man waves you over.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) Surprisingly average, this man keeps an eye on the curios for sale.

(Red Aura) Surprisingly average, this man keeps an eye on the curios for sale.
(Red Aura) A petitioner of the Guild tries to peddle off some gems.
(Red Aura) A member of the Guild walks the alleys, perusing the available wares.
A large bouncer checks to ensure that no unscrupulous folk approach the alleys.
A large bouncer grips you by your collar and britches, tossing you out onto the cobblestones!

moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1228/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
e
Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel gives you a mighty kick, sending you flying away from the bridge!
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1227/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)

s
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1226/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
w
w
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1225/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>

(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

n

INFO: 30 minutes of bonus experience remaining.

The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**]
    The signature smell of Fellchantry (jokingly referred to as "Kettermoor
Cologne") wafts in with particular potency from the west, hinting at
the docks to be found in that direction. The aroma, not so much unpleasant
as it is unusual, has strong fishy accents punctuated with less-identifiable
effluvia. Fishmongers exhort the crowds with carny-like shouts, each
extolling the freshness and superiority of their particular wares. The
occasional prostitute wanders through, on their way to providing the
services of Andolor's oldest profession to the dock crowd.
 
  Fellchantry's docks lie to the west, offering an escape from the square.
Farther east an unusually lively building boasts signs claiming the coldest
beer in the Barony.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
[**> PK <**] >>
n
l;ex
A Cramped Alleyway
  This particular alleyway - unlike many of the others in which the denizens of
Fellchantry conduct their lucrative business - finds itself oddly quiet.
Mayhaps it be that Fellchantry Square itself is the central hustle of the 
settlement, paving the way towards bars, men or women for hire and narrow 
passages offering an escape from day-to-day struggles. Mayhaps, in fact, it 
be that there is actually clean and running water trickling away to the 
north; one could surmise that the town's aversion to anything not coming out 
of a bar keeps stragglers at bay.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1233/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
An older gentleman in fine dress tends to the many curios in the shop.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1232/1240 mv  76tnl

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1230/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1229/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) (west) ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1228/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E][W])
>>
op w
w
You open the door.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1228/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]W)
>>
The Guild
  The working class of Fellchantry: the Guild is a simple stone building which 
one may mistake for a tavern or bar at a glance. Tables and chairs are 
littered across the area in no particular pattern. At the far western edge of
the room is a long, wide bar, the wall behind it lined with wooden shelves 
housing a large selection of liquors with no label or indication of what it 
may be, though whatever barkeep may be servicing the organization's members 
seems to know exactly what lies where, what goes into what, and which 
concoction to conjure. Upon the northern and southern walls are a scattering 
of mis-matched decor. Right next to a large tapestry is a taxidermied boar's 
head, or an emblem with crossed swords embossed upon a wooden panel would 
hang askew, teetering on the edge of harpooning the skull of whoever may find 
themselves beneath it should it eventually decide to fall.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1227/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | The Guild (E)
>>
op e
e
La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) west ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1226/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]W)
>>
You open the door.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1226/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (NEW)
>>
Bell and Ball
  Much of this manor appears to be closed off for no particular purpose, though
the foyer is massive. The expansive area houses a large selection of 
embroidered carpets running along the outer edges of the room, its center a 
smooth and polished wooden dancefloor. At all times of day, dignitaries can 
be seen moving in and out, drinking their fine wines, wearing their fine 
clothes, and dancing to fine music. A chalice rests at the northwestern side 
of the room, ever-overflowing into a large basin with a smooth and 
rich-smelling liquor from which the patrons of the manor ladle into their 
goblets.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
     (Magic) An Everlasting Chalice rests in the corner of the room, spilling wine.
(Red Aura) A man in finery schmoozes with the guests.
(Red Aura) One of Fellchantry's serving girls slips between dancing couples with a platter of
beverages.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A picture of elegance and grace, this woman is twirled by her dance partner.

>>
The Guild
  The working class of Fellchantry: the Guild is a simple stone building which 
one may mistake for a tavern or bar at a glance. Tables and chairs are 
littered across the area in no particular pattern. At the far western edge of
the room is a long, wide bar, the wall behind it lined with wooden shelves 
housing a large selection of liquors with no label or indication of what it 
may be, though whatever barkeep may be servicing the organization's members 
seems to know exactly what lies where, what goes into what, and which 
concoction to conjure. Upon the northern and southern walls are a scattering 
of mis-matched decor. Right next to a large tapestry is a taxidermied boar's 
head, or an emblem with crossed swords embossed upon a wooden panel would 
hang askew, teetering on the edge of harpooning the skull of whoever may find 
themselves beneath it should it eventually decide to fall.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
A smirking woman leans back on a simple wooden chair, cleaning her nails with a knife.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1220/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (NEW)
>>
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1219/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1218/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
e

A shocked onlooker plods west.

Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1217/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
s
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1216/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.

>>
e

You see the grey moon rising in the east.

Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel gives you a mighty kick, sending you flying away from the bridge!

n
Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (ESW)
>>
e
Baron's Beerhouse
    Lauded as the place to be in Fellchantry, the ironically named "Baron's 
Beerhouse" (most likely never visited by the Baron himself, if rumor is to be
believed) houses a massive selection of tables, chairs, sounds, smells and 
people. The walls are adorned with basic decor and sconces which have long 
since been coated by wax from dripping candles, then coated again and never
cleaned. Smoke hangs in the air as thick as the noise generated by the 
milling of bodies and full-bellied laughter.

To the west, double-doors lead back out into the square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east west ]
(Golden Aura) Who would have thought that scales could flush?  This Lizardman must be toasted.
(Red Aura) A man in a cloak purses his lips and watches the door.
(Red Aura) A man in a cloak purses his lips and watches the door.
(Golden Aura) This barmaid spends more of her time flirting than serving.
(Golden Aura) Who would have thought that scales could flush?  This Lizardman must be toasted.
(Red Aura) A rowdy ruffian laughs and throws another punch.

>>
e
Baron's Beerhouse
  Perhaps the busiest corner of the beerhouse, this area has a seating 
arrangement in the form of booths which line the eastern and southern edges 
of the area. A preferred space, no doubt, as these seats appear to be 
permanently occupied by those who would use line of sight to the western 
doors to their advantage. Some call it anxiety, yet others may suggest that 
it is mere precaution given the nature of work conducted in the Barony.

<MAPEND>

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1236/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Baron's Beerhouse (NW)
>>
n
Baron's Beerhouse
  A lofty corner, the great bar of the Baron's Beerhouse runs in a large L 
across the northern and eastern wall, eventually terminating in a small door 
which swings this way and that as bartenders move their way in and out to 
serve the establishment's patrons. Many of the more relaxed, or perhaps 
careless, folk sit here with their backs to the door at the bar's edge, 
jokingly referred to as the "maintenance team" for keeping the taps flowing 
and the kegs empty as payment. Laughter rolls through the air of the 
beerhouse, almost as if trapped in permanent festivity.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
(Red Aura) A rowdy ruffian laughs and throws another punch.
(Red Aura) A rowdy ruffian laughs and throws another punch.
(Golden Aura) Who would have thought that scales could flush?  This Lizardman must be toasted.
Toram, the muscular Lizardman barkeep, stands behind the counter, cleaning out a glass.

w
Baron's Beerhouse
  A quieter corner of the beerhouse, though merely in comparison as opposed to 
fact or widely accepted truth, laughter can be heard rolling through the area
from all directions. More broody folk appear to make themselves at home here,
corner tables and chairs allowing a decent view of the area, though spaced 
apart enough for some to enjoy their drinks in relative solitude. The wall 
sconces here are caked to the brim with old wax, the idea of replenishing the
candles in this spot a long forgotten memory.

To the south one may find the beerhouse's exit.
