Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (ESW)
>>
w
Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**]
    The signature smell of Fellchantry (jokingly referred to as "Kettermoor
Cologne") wafts in with particular potency from the west, hinting at
the docks to be found in that direction. The aroma, not so much unpleasant
as it is unusual, has strong fishy accents punctuated with less-identifiable
effluvia. Fishmongers exhort the crowds with carny-like shouts, each
extolling the freshness and superiority of their particular wares. The
occasional prostitute wanders through, on their way to providing the
services of Andolor's oldest profession to the dock crowd.
 
  Fellchantry's docks lie to the west, offering an escape from the square.
Farther east an unusually lively building boasts signs claiming the coldest
beer in the Barony.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1231/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
[**> PK <**] >>
w
Fellchantry Square
  The presence of the barony's courthouse to the north does nothing to curb
the traffic of the usual ne'er-do-wells and cutthroats here. For the majority
of the Justiciars-- Fellchantry's city guards-- the pay just isn't good
enough to really make an effort. The occasional drunk gets roughed up, and
a murderer may even be arrested if he's a little too indiscrete, but in the
end it's just keeping up appearances. Who cares about a murder when no one
misses the deceased? Besides, everyone in Fellchantry is guilty of something.

  Justice waits to the north, longing for someone to avenge the slander done
to her name. The square looms predatorily to the east and south.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1230/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
Justiciar Headquarters
  This aged building, remarkable only in that it's slightly less run down than
the structures around it, is home to His Majesty's Justiciars. From here
Fellchantry's city guards work hard at the appearance of upholding justice.
In reality the guards are only about two steps removed from being criminals
themselves, and the sour reek of tobacco, alcohol, and sweat on the air says
much about the Justiciars' efficacy. Still, the Baron's coat of arms hangs
large on the wall, and that's all the legitimacy these men need.

  His Majesty's Kangaroo Court is in the western wing of the courthouse. To
the south wait the pickpockets and cutpurses of Fellchantry Square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
(Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.
One of the barony's detectives lounges on a chair with his feet in the air.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1229/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Justiciar Headquarters (SW)
>>
w
His Majesty's Court of Justice
  A large dais at the westernmost end of a long walkway is the most prominent
feature of His Majesty's Court of Justice. On it is a simple judge's bench,
its face decorated with the Baron's coat of arms. Those wondering about the
Baron's views on justice can find their questions answered by the large
painting that totally dominates the wall behind the bench. Simply titled,
"Justice," it depicts a woman with a radiant halo and pure white vestments
holding a sword aloft with one elegantly-sandled foot atop a pile of corpses.
It's not exactly the sort of court at whose mercy one throws oneself.
Non-descript hardwood benches are arranged in two aisles so that the
populace may observe the proceedings of the court, though few ever do.

  The way back east leads to the Justiciar Headquarters, and to the bustling
city square beyond.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.
(Invis) (Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.

s
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

INFO: HARDCORE Porcius has been killed by Kortai at level 14.

e
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.

e
n
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

>>
Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>

e
Baron's Beerhouse
    Lauded as the place to be in Fellchantry, the ironically named "Baron's 
Beerhouse" (most likely never visited by the Baron himself, if rumor is to be
believed) houses a massive selection of tables, chairs, sounds, smells and 
people. The walls are adorned with basic decor and sconces which have long 
since been coated by wax from dripping candles, then coated again and never
cleaned. Smoke hangs in the air as thick as the noise generated by the 
milling of bodies and full-bellied laughter.

To the west, double-doors lead back out into the square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east west ]

Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

s
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1231/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 560372 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
An older gentleman in fine dress tends to the many curios in the shop.

Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
s
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) Peddling his wares, this man waves you over.
(Red Aura) Peddling his wares, this man waves you over.

A large bouncer grips you by your collar and britches, tossing you out onto the cobblestones!
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1236/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.

e
Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel eyes you up and down, begrudgingly letting you pass as a petitioner.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1234/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Bridge Three (EW)
>>
Elroy Castle Entrance Hall
  How grand an entrance hall you find yourself within - serving wenches in nary
a linen and fine gentlemen wearing but scraps of silk - one would find 
themselves hard-pressed to be within such luxury if not for the subtle signs 
of cracks within the walls and ominous copper-like stains within the ceiling.
Alas, the marbled floors are home to great statues of even more marble and 
cheaper materials, no doubt having been harvested from proprietors who also 
produced the tasteless glass-shrouded chandeliers overhead.

<MAPEND>

Anssett (Special Ops) tells the CLAN: 'rofl'

e
Gentleman's Lounge
  It would so appear that the stories are true surrounding the opulent 
Gentleman's Lounge, housing and playing host to the more 'gentrified' movers 
and shakers of Fellchantry's recreational activities. A grand, stained 
wooden bar arches in a crescent along the eastern wall, accompanied by 
several padded stools for patrons to seat themselves on. Scattered throughout
the room are rounded coffee tables, each flanked by expertly carved armchairs
and ice buckets holding frosted heavy liquors. The air tinges blue as it 
hangs thickly with smoke - a consolidation of wet tobacco, molasses and 
cherry.

Westwards the lounge opens further towards the rest of the castle.

Elroy Castle Dining Hall
  One may begin to wonder at the splendor of others' dining conditions.
Stretching a good twenty or thirty feet from the west to the east, the room 
finds itself divided by a lengthy table. Opulence drips from the room as the 
fine wooden surface is packed with fresh flowers (probably imported), golden 
(or perhaps gold plated) cutlery arranged to precision and perhaps the 
longest cut of silken cloth ever conceived, draped over the dark-stained oak.
Up above a chandelier dangles threateningly, the sconces attached to it 
adorned with iron spikes pointed to the floor (and perhaps guests) below.

<MAPEND>

w
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1234/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
w
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1233/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
s
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1232/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 386152 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Anssett is enjoying some cheese with that whine.
An older gentleman in fine dress tends to the many curios in the shop.

5437/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1231/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | The General Store (N)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Anssett is enjoying some cheese with that whine.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1240/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | Fellchantry Square (NES)

e

Anssett prays for safe passage home!
Anssett disappears.

Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1239/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
e
s
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1238/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1237/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | Brimtoil Alley (NS)
>>
s
Brimtoil Alley
  Past the northern bustle one comes to the calmer, plainer and saner
environment of Fellchantry's alleyways. There are still the odd buildings 
with awkward doors upon surprisingly sturdy hinges from which men and women 
conduct their many creative business ventures, though they are sparser, the 
people here skinnier and rattier, their eyes sharper, and their weapons 
always at hand. A sharp curve eventually leads across a small bridge to the 
east, eventually plunging even deeper into the (known) underbelly of the 
barony.

<MAPEND>

e
Bogboil Bridge
  Some may call it a bridge, others may call it a hack, but the fact that it 
allows people to cross water is one set in stone. A multitude of planks run 
from one end of the stone pavement across a narrow river from the western to 
the eastern side. The tightly-packed buildings receive a bit of a gap here, 
though one may spy that a few brave souls have taken it upon themselves to 
construct ramshackle balconies in order to appreciate their 'ocean view'.
Eastwards, the alleyways split at an intersection and vanish beyond sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Red Aura) A member of the Guild walks the alleys, perusing the available wares.
(Red Aura) A petitioner of the Guild tries to peddle off some gems.
(Red Aura) Someone's hands simply cannot leave others' pockets alone, and this is one of them.
(Red Aura) Surprisingly average, this man keeps an eye on the curios for sale.
(Red Aura) A petitioner of the Guild tries to peddle off some gems.

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1235/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | Bogboil Bridge (EW)
>>
e
Treadway Alley
  A rather open space for an alley, a multitude of tables and chairs are 
scattered around the area, serving as a quaint space for an outdoor drink or 
smoke among the regulars in this area. Some of the doors against the eastern 
buildings lead towards shops, some to homes, and others to homes with their 
back rooms converted into shops, all selling a series of curious wares of 
varying value. The cobblestones underfoot appear to be dark and glisten 
always, as if moistened under the toil of recent rains despite the 
ever-present overhead gloom.

The alleyway continues to the north and south, westwards lies Bogboil Bridge.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south west ]

n
Treadway Alley
  The pleasantries seemingly associated with Treadway Alley continue here, some
tables and chairs scattered about the alley. Frequenters would find 
themselves here reading the new gossip prints of the week over a drink or 
warm beverage and a warm pastry produced from an adjecent bakery. It is clear
that if one were to look for folk with fewer scruples, a journey deeper into 
the network of alleyways may be in order.

A bend in the path leads eastwards, one's northern and western flanks blocked
off by buildings.

e
Murder Alley
  A bit of a narrower path between buildings, this area does not seem to 
receive a lot of traffic. The buildings which flank the road to the north and
south are a bit more ramshackle, the air feels a bit colder, and the ground 
is a bit grimier. Upon closer inspection of the northern building, one may 
notice the trademark giving this passage its name. A splash of dark paint 
(someone dropped a bucket, no doubt) smears across the wall, the impact 
having left many spots, giving one the illusion that a throat was cut.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Red Aura) A member of the Guild walks the alleys, perusing the available wares.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) You could have sworn you just saw...

5094/5094 HP  5527/5527 MP  1228/1240 mv  76tnl  
Lv 164  G 236232 | Murder Alley (EW)
>>
Bottlebreak Alley [**> PK <**]
  The smells wafting through this alley are less charming than those elsewhere 
within the Barony, but not bad enough for one to run for the hills. Folk who 
traffic here tend to always have a bottle tucked beneath an arm, however, as 
they move from one seedy tavern to another, eyeing anyone who they may not 
recognize suspiciously. Words can be had about the general odour of unwashed 
bodies, however. The state of the surrounding buildings does not suggest 
dilapidation to the point where its denizens should look and smell the way 
they do, though the feeling of complacency hangs thick in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]

2244/5127 HP  5569/5569 MP  1261/1261 mv  836tnl
 Enemy: 32%HP (mob) | 43% HP (you)[**> PK <**]  >>
Bottlebreak Alley [**> PK <**]
  The alleyway terminates at this point very much in the same way that it does 
to the north. Most human sounds are either sniffling, coughing or someone 
losing their breakfast. The odour of rum and fish is thick in the air, most 
denizens of Bottlebreak alley mostly not bothering with commerce as opposed 
to the paths closer to Fellchantry Square. Much of the ground has eroded 
here, causing buildings to fall into disrepair and become damaged by small 
rivulets of water which seep through from the far west.

Northwards, a bend leads back to Murder Alley.

1912/5127 HP  5569/5569 MP  1260/1261 mv  846tnl
 Enemy: 100%HP (mob) | 37% HP (you)[**> PK <**]  >>
Bottlebreak Alley [**> PK <**]
  The smells wafting through this alley are less charming than those elsewhere 
within the Barony, but not bad enough for one to run for the hills. Folk who 
traffic here tend to always have a bottle tucked beneath an arm, however, as 
they move from one seedy tavern to another, eyeing anyone who they may not 
recognize suspiciously. Words can be had about the general odour of unwashed 
bodies, however. The state of the surrounding buildings does not suggest 
dilapidation to the point where its denizens should look and smell the way 
they do, though the feeling of complacency hangs thick in the air.

1647/5127 HP  5569/5569 MP  1257/1261 mv  876tnl
 Enemy: 32%HP (mob) | 32% HP (you)[**> PK <**]  >>
Murder Alley
  A bit of a narrower path between buildings, this area does not seem to 
receive a lot of traffic. The buildings which flank the road to the north and
south are a bit more ramshackle, the air feels a bit colder, and the ground 
is a bit grimier. Upon closer inspection of the northern building, one may 
notice the trademark giving this passage its name. A splash of dark paint 
(someone dropped a bucket, no doubt) smears across the wall, the impact 
having left many spots, giving one the illusion that a throat was cut.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Red Aura) A member of the Guild walks the alleys, perusing the available wares.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) You could have sworn you just saw...
You flee from combat!
You lose 10 exp for your cowardice.

Treadway Alley
  The pleasantries seemingly associated with Treadway Alley continue here, some
tables and chairs scattered about the alley. Frequenters would find 
themselves here reading the new gossip prints of the week over a drink or 
warm beverage and a warm pastry produced from an adjecent bakery. It is clear
that if one were to look for folk with fewer scruples, a journey deeper into 
the network of alleyways may be in order.

A bend in the path leads eastwards, one's northern and western flanks blocked
off by buildings.

s
Treadway Alley
  A rather open space for an alley, a multitude of tables and chairs are 
scattered around the area, serving as a quaint space for an outdoor drink or 
smoke among the regulars in this area. Some of the doors against the eastern 
buildings lead towards shops, some to homes, and others to homes with their 
back rooms converted into shops, all selling a series of curious wares of 
varying value. The cobblestones underfoot appear to be dark and glisten 
always, as if moistened under the toil of recent rains despite the 
ever-present overhead gloom.

The alleyway continues to the north and south, westwards lies Bogboil Bridge.

<MAPEND>

>>
Magnificent Marceline
  A curio shop, Magnificent Marceline carries itself upon its reputation.
Chairs and tables dot the space, allowing patrons to have a seat while they 
peruse the weird and wonderful wares that the proprietor of the store has for
sale. Dreamcatchers hang from the ceiling, sporting feathers which may just 
barely brush the heads of taller races. At the far eastern edge of the room 
is a small counter where the owner of the shop tends to purchases, happy to 
make their customers' pockets a wee bit lighter.

<MAPEND>

Mister Goodwin says, "Ah, a good fellow that.  I had some conjecture as to the ruckus beyond my
door, though there are two types of business."

Mister Goodwin says, "Their problems and mine.  An invaluable philosophy to have in Fellchantry,
though it appears I have failed by postulating that you were aware of the fact."

Mister Goodwin says, "I digress, I shall indulge your inquisitive nature."

Mister Goodwin says, "The boy was bit of a zounderkite, though had heart.  He was drawn to an
heirloom, rooted deeply in the barony's history."

Mister Goodwin says, "A jeweled egg, intended as a gift to his inamorata.  I believe her name is...
Marceline, yes.  Quiz her on its whereabouts."

Mister Goodwin says, "You may deduce that the egg itself's very existence is the source of much
contention, though none had thought to inquire whether I had possession of it.

La Rochelle Row (1252)

La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) (west) ]

5127/5127 HP  5569/5569 MP  1251/1261 mv  878tnl  
Lv 165  G 227161 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]W)
>>
The Guild
  The working class of Fellchantry: the Guild is a simple stone building which 
one may mistake for a tavern or bar at a glance. Tables and chairs are 
littered across the area in no particular pattern. At the far western edge of
the room is a long, wide bar, the wall behind it lined with wooden shelves 
housing a large selection of liquors with no label or indication of what it 
may be, though whatever barkeep may be servicing the organization's members 
seems to know exactly what lies where, what goes into what, and which 
concoction to conjure. Upon the northern and southern walls are a scattering 
of mis-matched decor. Right next to a large tapestry is a taxidermied boar's 
head, or an emblem with crossed swords embossed upon a wooden panel would 
hang askew, teetering on the edge of harpooning the skull of whoever may find 
themselves beneath it should it eventually decide to fall.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]

say jeweled egg
You say 'jeweled egg'
Tien dul Vitorri asks, "Elucidate, you do not retain possession of it?"
Tien dul Vitorri tilts her head.
Tien dul Vitorri says, "'Tis true, however.  I would not deign to assume
 that the Guild are the only who seek it."
Tien dul Vitorri says, "Would we have slit a few throats to gain
 possession of the prized heirloom of Fellchantry's founders? 
 Absolutely."
Tien dul Vitorri says, "Have we, though?  Nay, young one.  Nay, it is
 unfortunate that I cannot claim responsibility for such a deed."
Tien dul Vitorri asks, "Ah, but you seek the killer, yes?"
Tien dul Vitorri says, "The killer themselves most likely still have
 possession of it.  Legend speaks of its presence driving people to
 unspeakable acts."
Tien dul Vitorri says, "If the more common set of sticky fingers had come
 to its ownership, then you may be required to direct your queries to
 Toram."
Tien dul Vitorri says, "He's the large lizardman at the beerhouse
 northeast of the square.  I can guarantee you that the egg is not present
 in the alleys.  My eyes and ears would have known by now."
You jot down the statement and have Tien sign it.  She complies with only minor protest.
You receive a [ Sheaf of Notes ] from Tien dul Vitorri.

Baron's Beerhouse
  A lofty corner, the great bar of the Baron's Beerhouse runs in a large L 
across the northern and eastern wall, eventually terminating in a small door 
which swings this way and that as bartenders move their way in and out to 
serve the establishment's patrons. Many of the more relaxed, or perhaps 
careless, folk sit here with their backs to the door at the bar's edge, 
jokingly referred to as the "maintenance team" for keeping the taps flowing 
and the kegs empty as payment. Laughter rolls through the air of the 
beerhouse, almost as if trapped in permanent festivity.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
(Red Aura) A man in a cloak purses his lips and watches the door.
Toram, the muscular Lizardman barkeep, stands behind the counter, cleaning out a glass.

4623/5127 HP  5372/5569 MP  1260/1261 mv  815tnl  
Lv 165  G 233762 | Baron's Beerhouse (SW)
>>
say jeweled egg
You say 'jeweled egg'
Toram asks, "Hm?"
Toram pauses, setting down the glass he was wiping down on the counter.
Toram says, "Aye, I knew the lad.  He was a regular 'ere.  Frequently
 ventured into the tavern to pretend being a drunkard."
Toram shrugs helplessly.
Toram says, "He was a lucrative customer, however.  The boy would drop
 mighty fine coin in tips as he was the baron's silversmith."
Toram says, "Another lad would shadow him - be his tail.  The lot were
 like brothers after all.  I believe his name was Jonah.  Jonah Nessim."
Toram says, "I never caught much of their conversations.  So long the
 drink flows, I get my weight's worth."
Toram says, "His mistress and this 'ere place were his only reasons to
 leave the castle.  If he were to declare truth on his life to anyone, it
 would be the baron himself.  Query Jonah to him, and he may elucidate on
 the particulars."
You capture the statement and have Toram sign it.  The burly lizardman does not protest, and gives
you a wink as he slides the sheaf back to you over the countertop.
You receive a [ Sheaf of Notes ] from Toram.

Baron's Beerhouse
  Perhaps the busiest corner of the beerhouse, this area has a seating 
arrangement in the form of booths which line the eastern and southern edges 
of the area. A preferred space, no doubt, as these seats appear to be 
permanently occupied by those who would use line of sight to the western 
doors to their advantage. Some call it anxiety, yet others may suggest that 
it is mere precaution given the nature of work conducted in the Barony.

Treadway Alley
  A rather open space for an alley, a multitude of tables and chairs are 
scattered around the area, serving as a quaint space for an outdoor drink or 
smoke among the regulars in this area. Some of the doors against the eastern 
buildings lead towards shops, some to homes, and others to homes with their 
back rooms converted into shops, all selling a series of curious wares of 
varying value. The cobblestones underfoot appear to be dark and glisten 
always, as if moistened under the toil of recent rains despite the 
ever-present overhead gloom.

The alleyway continues to the north and south, westwards lies Bogboil Bridge.

s
Treadway Alley
  The quaint atmosphere of Treadway Alley is tantamount here, bars and 
restaurants and coffee shop owners peddling the "best seats in the house".
The scent of freshly baked confectionary hangs thickly in the air and one may
soon discover that beyond the face-value of Fellchantry rests an entire 
community and culture unseen. Somewhat more ragged than those who settle 
closer to the centre of Fellchantry, children can be seen running and 
playing, much to the chargin of their elders who traffic the alleyway.

<MAPEND>

e
Chantry Commons
  A small attempt at emulating Fellchantry Square, a less grandiose open space 
among the alleys has been appropriated by locals and turned into a market.
Stalls manned by peddlers are set about the area, shouts ringing through the 
air guaranteeing quality and quantity for their patrons' hard earned coin.
From buildings on all sides, cords hang from roof to roof for the sake of 
dangling flags and other colorful decoration for this lively environment. A 
set of alleyways split off to the south and to the east, leading deeper into 
Fellchantry's underbelly network.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
(Red Aura) Peddling his wares, this man waves you over.

Monisier Alley
  A small alleyway terminates here right off the eastern edge of the Chantry 
Commons. The far eastern wall features a single door which no doubt leads to 
someone's abode, though it is flanked by a great collection of metal artworks
which glimmer in the dim Fellchantry gloom. Frequently someone with finer 
dress would peruse the wares or speak to the artist responsible, often 
walking away with their pockets a few coins lighter. Along the northern and 
southern edges, two-storey buildings rise up and obfuscate anything beyond 
them.

Westwards lies the Chantry Commons, and one can hear the signature cries
of peddlers.

Oberon Alley
  Oberon Alley carries much of the vibrancy which one could find at the Chantry
Commons - more a road than an alley, its occupants appear to take great care 
in maintaining a respectable environment. Rumour on the lips of all who have 
bothered to set foot here speaks of the road's name, lauded after an ancient 
and obscure individual who found the secret to eternal life. It is evident in
the decorations which all doors on the eastern and western flanks have on 
them - every one a slightly different variant of the same thing: A wooden 
carving of a wolf howling at the moon.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]

Oberon Alley
  Flags of bright color are draped wherever the occupants of this area could 
find a spot, the vibrant atmosphere continuing even this far south of the 
Chantry Commons. Here one can still see a multitude of howling wolf carvings 
draped above neighbourhood doors. Some of the tightly packed houses feature 
something which one could consider quite unique for this side of the barony, 
and that is the presence of potted plants and blooming flowers.

The alley curves sharply to the west, leading towards a park.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north west ]

4156/5127 HP  4465/5569 MP  1245/1261 mv  747tnl  
Lv 165  G 199063 | Oberon Alley (NW)

w
Oberon Nook
  The alleyways eventually open up into Oberon Nook, very much resembling a 
park tucked away in a forgotten corner of the barony. The grasses which roll 
across the area are maintained with care, the sparse scattering of trees also
adding to the charm of this 'clearing' between buildings. Several benches are
featured, at least one occupied at all times while children entertain 
themselves in the open space under the supervision of the eternal gloomy sky 
overhead.

Eastwards, one may travel back to the vibrant Oberon Alley.

<MAPEND>

find a spot, the vibrant atmosphere continuing even this far south of the 
Chantry Commons. Here one can still see a multitude of howling wolf carvings 
draped above neighbourhood doors. Some of the tightly packed houses feature 
something which one could consider quite unique for this side of the barony, 
and that is the presence of potted plants and blooming flowers.

The alley curves sharply to the west, leading towards a park.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north west ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) That scoundrel over there looks like he's trying to avoid notice!
(Red Aura) Someone's hands simply cannot leave others' pockets alone, and this is one of them.
(Red Aura) This bartering customer appears fairly annoyed at the 'unreasonable pricing'.

4156/5127 HP  4465/5569 MP  1244/1261 mv  747tnl  
Lv 165  G 199063 | Oberon Alley (NW)
>>
n


Oberon Alley
  Oberon Alley carries much of the vibrancy which one could find at the Chantry
Commons - more a road than an alley, its occupants appear to take great care 
in maintaining a respectable environment. Rumour on the lips of all who have 
bothered to set foot here speaks of the road's name, lauded after an ancient 
and obscure individual who found the secret to eternal life. It is evident in
the decorations which all doors on the eastern and western flanks have on 
them - every one a slightly different variant of the same thing: A wooden 
carving of a wolf howling at the moon.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) That scoundrel over there looks like he's trying to avoid notice!

4198/5127 HP  4581/5569 MP  1260/1261 mv  747tnl  
Lv 165  G 199063 | Oberon Alley (NS)
>>
Chantry Commons
  A small attempt at emulating Fellchantry Square, a less grandiose open space 
among the alleys has been appropriated by locals and turned into a market.
Stalls manned by peddlers are set about the area, shouts ringing through the 
air guaranteeing quality and quantity for their patrons' hard earned coin.
From buildings on all sides, cords hang from roof to roof for the sake of 
dangling flags and other colorful decoration for this lively environment. A 
set of alleyways split off to the south and to the east, leading deeper into 
Fellchantry's underbelly network.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
(Red Aura) Peddling his wares, this man waves you over.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) You could have sworn you just saw...

4198/5127 HP  4581/5569 MP  1259/1261 mv  747tnl  
Lv 165  G 199063 | Chantry Commons (ESW)

w
n
Treadway Alley
  The quaint atmosphere of Treadway Alley is tantamount here, bars and 
restaurants and coffee shop owners peddling the "best seats in the house".
The scent of freshly baked confectionary hangs thickly in the air and one may
soon discover that beyond the face-value of Fellchantry rests an entire 
community and culture unseen. Somewhat more ragged than those who settle 
closer to the centre of Fellchantry, children can be seen running and 
playing, much to the chargin of their elders who traffic the alleyway.

4198/5127 HP  4581/5569 MP  1259/1261 mv  747tnl

n
Treadway Alley
  A rather open space for an alley, a multitude of tables and chairs are 
scattered around the area, serving as a quaint space for an outdoor drink or 
smoke among the regulars in this area. Some of the doors against the eastern 
buildings lead towards shops, some to homes, and others to homes with their 
back rooms converted into shops, all selling a series of curious wares of 
varying value. The cobblestones underfoot appear to be dark and glisten 
always, as if moistened under the toil of recent rains despite the 
ever-present overhead gloom.

The alleyway continues to the north and south, westwards lies Bogboil Bridge.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south west ]

op e
e
Treadway Alley
  The pleasantries seemingly associated with Treadway Alley continue here, some
tables and chairs scattered about the alley. Frequenters would find 
themselves here reading the new gossip prints of the week over a drink or 
warm beverage and a warm pastry produced from an adjecent bakery. It is clear
that if one were to look for folk with fewer scruples, a journey deeper into 
the network of alleyways may be in order.

A bend in the path leads eastwards, one's northern and western flanks blocked
off by buildings.

>>
Murder Alley
  A bit of a narrower path between buildings, this area does not seem to 
receive a lot of traffic. The buildings which flank the road to the north and
south are a bit more ramshackle, the air feels a bit colder, and the ground 
is a bit grimier. Upon closer inspection of the northern building, one may 
notice the trademark giving this passage its name. A splash of dark paint 
(someone dropped a bucket, no doubt) smears across the wall, the impact 
having left many spots, giving one the illusion that a throat was cut.

<MAPEND>

Bottlebreak Alley [**> PK <**]
  The smells wafting through this alley are less charming than those elsewhere 
within the Barony, but not bad enough for one to run for the hills. Folk who 
traffic here tend to always have a bottle tucked beneath an arm, however, as 
they move from one seedy tavern to another, eyeing anyone who they may not 
recognize suspiciously. Words can be had about the general odour of unwashed 
bodies, however. The state of the surrounding buildings does not suggest 
dilapidation to the point where its denizens should look and smell the way 
they do, though the feeling of complacency hangs thick in the air.

Dead End in Bottlebreak Alley [**> PK <**]
  This particular pathway comes to an end here. The alley leads up to an 
unoccupied square with most buildings facing away from the alley itself, 
though the odd back door may be spied where servants or tenants would empty 
their chamberpots out onto the cobble underfoot. Wheels with wire along their
edges are mounted from east to west, top-floor tenants pinning and rolling 
(rare) laundry out to dry. Some of those textiles still drip beneath the 
eternal gloom of Fellchantry.

w
Bogboil Bridge
  Some may call it a bridge, others may call it a hack, but the fact that it 
allows people to cross water is one set in stone. A multitude of planks run 
from one end of the stone pavement across a narrow river from the western to 
the eastern side. The tightly-packed buildings receive a bit of a gap here, 
though one may spy that a few brave souls have taken it upon themselves to 
construct ramshackle balconies in order to appreciate their 'ocean view'.
Eastwards, the alleyways split at an intersection and vanish beyond sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]

Brimtoil Alley (1260)

Brimtoil Alley (1259)

The locals appear to recognize your pin and allow you to pass into the alleys.
Fellchantry Square (1258)

Fellchantry Square (1257)

The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.

4131/5127 HP  4545/5569 MP  1256/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>


e
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

e
Elroy Castle Entrance Hall
  How grand an entrance hall you find yourself within - serving wenches in nary
a linen and fine gentlemen wearing but scraps of silk - one would find 
themselves hard-pressed to be within such luxury if not for the subtle signs 
of cracks within the walls and ominous copper-like stains within the ceiling.
Alas, the marbled floors are home to great statues of even more marble and 
cheaper materials, no doubt having been harvested from proprietors who also 
produced the tasteless glass-shrouded chandeliers overhead.

<MAPEND>

chest.

The baron's guardsman plods in from the east.

u
An Opulent Landing
  A grand attempt at appearing gentrified, sleek marbling across the polished 
floors stretch out towards heavy sets of doors to the north, south, west and 
east. The stairs terminate at a landing carpeted in bright crimson, 
eventually stretching in each of the aforementioned directions. Another set 
of marble stairs with golden railings ascends further upwards, piercing 
towards the peak of the castle where it eventually reaches a balcony 
overlooking all those who traffic here.

>>
Governer's Retreat
  An odd blend of purpose is palpable when one steps into this room. It could 
be considered an opulent sitting room when the elaborate couches and 
armchairs are taken into consideration, all stacked in a comfortable 
half-circle about the hearth and centered with a polished teak coffee table, 
housing a platter with a porcelain jug and several delicate cups or fluted 
glasses. To the far eastern side, however, resting before large windows which
overlook the sprawling valleys past the barony, is a desk with delicate 
silver inlay, its amenities at this point a pressing plate for paper and a 
stoppered inkwell with a goosefeather quill resting at its side.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]

A Destitute Nursery
  Either this room was never used or was an afterthought when the castle was 
decorated, though its purpose remains relatively clear. Simple curtains of 
bland cottons cascade down from their railings to the floor, dragging through
the dust whenever a breeze strikes. At the center of the room rests a cradle,
and a wooden rocking chair sits unused in the northeastern corner of the 
area. The floors and walls are of simple and unadorned stone, their only 
feature being built-in cabinets with basic (and probably expired) amenities.

<MAPEND>

(Golden Aura) A woman walks past with bundles in her arms.

Elroy Library
  Red carpet obfuscates the sound of footsteps, providing the area with
utter silence. Motes of dust sparkle in the light which streams in from the 
large, glass-inlaid balcony doors to the west, no doubt cast off from the 
small (though supposedly great, by the barony's standards) shelves which line
every other wall of the room, housing ledgers, tomes and volumes of many 
obscure topics and esoteric relevance.

>>
Lady's Fainting Chamber (G)
  In this particular room, the cold stone walls are paneled with dark and 
polished wooden slats of some arcane kind. Silken sheets find themselves 
draped from the edges of the room to cover the ceiling, tying in a knot at 
the center of the area. One could consider this a bedroom of sorts, as a 
veiled bed rests with its headrest against one wall, though a fainting couch 
and other seating arrangements have been assembled around a hearth against 
the eastern side of the room. South leads towards a small balcony - easily 
considered to be a waste of resources considering its insignificant size - 
overlooking the more 'reputable' part of Fellchantry, if one would believe 
such a thing exists.

<MAPEND>

(Golden Aura) A woman in an extremely tight corset sits at her vanity, powdering her nose...

4401/5127 HP  4982/5569 MP  1261/1261 mv  483tnl

You return to the living world.

help damage
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Damage.
Help Category : Utility.
Related Helps : Damage Verbs, Spamreduce, Dtrack.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-04 18:57:16.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: damage          : Shows damage options and current setting.
        damage <number> : Sets a listed damage option.

The 'damage' command allows you to change the way damage messages are 
displayed to you. You can combine all hits per round of combat and see 
either a total or the average. You can also combine hits per damage type
and view much smaller simplified damage message. 

See 'help dtrack' for how to measure your damage over time.

The full list of damage settings available is:

     0 - Regular damage output. One line per hit.
     1 - Total damage per round of combat - regular damage output.
     2 - Total damage per round of combat - basic damage output.
     3 - Average damage per round of combat - regular damage output.
     4 - Average damage per round of combat - basic damage output.
     5 - Total damage per round of combat - very short basic output.
     6 - Total per round for each damage type - regular output.

Known Issues:

There are some areas in the MUD where damage settings are not fully
respected yet. Listing those here so they don't get repeatedly posted as
bugs:


* Immunity messages and complete misses don't combine.

* Charge does not combine. This is a big one for some people - the
  skill needs to be rewritten to do damage in a different order. This will
  get fixed.

* Counter strike or similar 'reflected' damage does not combine.

* Auto-damage stuff like Gaias and Test of Faith, Counter-Strike etc
  is not combined. This one will be fixed.

* Reciting a scroll with multiple attack spells will show the combined
  damage as if it were just a single spell unless damage type is 6.

* Special stuff like rainbow and prismatic spray is not combined.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

4453/5127 HP  5049/5569 MP  1261/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Lady's Fainting Chamber (N)
>>
An Opulent Landing
  A grand attempt at appearing gentrified, sleek marbling across the polished 
floors stretch out towards heavy sets of doors to the north, south, west and 
east. The stairs terminate at a landing carpeted in bright crimson, 
eventually stretching in each of the aforementioned directions. Another set 
of marble stairs with golden railings ascends further upwards, piercing 
towards the peak of the castle where it eventually reaches a balcony 
overlooking all those who traffic here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Golden Aura) Absolutely strapping, this young lad chases the petitioners around to get them settled
down.
(Golden Aura) A woman walks past with bundles in her arms.

4453/5127 HP  5049/5569 MP  1261/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | An Opulent Landing (NESWUD)
>>
u
A Spiralling Stairwell
  A grand set of marble stairs with golden railings twist from below, 
eventually tightening as one continues to travel upwards before reaching a 
small landing with two utterly basic potted plants flanking a set of wooden 
doors which lead towards the Baron's offices. These doors appear to be locked
at all times, the man in charge only ever peeking past a slit within one of 
the barriers before permitting entry to whomsoever bequeaths an audience with
him.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (up) down ]
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A young woman in heavy dress clasps a sheaf of papers close to her
chest.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A young woman in heavy dress clasps a sheaf of papers close to her
chest.
(Golden Aura) A fully armored man patrols the halls.
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) Absolutely strapping, this young lad chases the petitioners around to get
them settled down.
A large sentinel stands guard at the Baron's office doors.

An Opulent Landing

floors stretch out towards heavy sets of doors to the north, south, west and

Lv 165  G 142556 | An Opulent Landing (NESWUD)
>>
d
Elroy Castle Entrance Hall
  How grand an entrance hall you find yourself within - serving wenches in nary
a linen and fine gentlemen wearing but scraps of silk - one would find 
themselves hard-pressed to be within such luxury if not for the subtle signs 
of cracks within the walls and ominous copper-like stains within the ceiling.
Alas, the marbled floors are home to great statues of even more marble and 
cheaper materials, no doubt having been harvested from proprietors who also 
produced the tasteless glass-shrouded chandeliers overhead.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west up ]
(Golden Aura) A woman walks past with bundles in her arms.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A frazzled woman rushes about the castle with her identicals, giving
orders.
(Golden Aura) A fully armored man patrols the halls.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A young woman in heavy dress clasps a sheaf of papers close to her
chest.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A frazzled woman rushes about the castle with her identicals, giving
orders.

4510/5127 HP  5146/5569 MP  1259/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Elroy Castle Entrance Hall (ESWU)
>>
e
Gentleman's Lounge
  It would so appear that the stories are true surrounding the opulent 
Gentleman's Lounge, housing and playing host to the more 'gentrified' movers 
and shakers of Fellchantry's recreational activities. A grand, stained 
wooden bar arches in a crescent along the eastern wall, accompanied by 
several padded stools for patrons to seat themselves on. Scattered throughout
the room are rounded coffee tables, each flanked by expertly carved armchairs
and ice buckets holding frosted heavy liquors. The air tinges blue as it 
hangs thickly with smoke - a consolidation of wet tobacco, molasses and 
cherry.

Westwards the lounge opens further towards the rest of the castle.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) Absolutely strapping, this young lad chases the petitioners around to get
them settled down.
(Golden Aura) A woman walks past with bundles in her arms.

orders.

chest.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) Absolutely strapping, this young lad chases the petitioners around to
get them settled down.
(Golden Aura) A fully armored man patrols the halls.

>>
w
Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel eyes you up and down, begrudgingly letting you pass as a petitioner.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1259/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Bridge Three (EW)
>>
w
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1258/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
w
Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1257/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Fellchantry Square (ESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**]
    The signature smell of Fellchantry (jokingly referred to as "Kettermoor
Cologne") wafts in with particular potency from the west, hinting at
the docks to be found in that direction. The aroma, not so much unpleasant
as it is unusual, has strong fishy accents punctuated with less-identifiable
effluvia. Fishmongers exhort the crowds with carny-like shouts, each
extolling the freshness and superiority of their particular wares. The
occasional prostitute wanders through, on their way to providing the
services of Andolor's oldest profession to the dock crowd.
 
  Fellchantry's docks lie to the west, offering an escape from the square.
Farther east an unusually lively building boasts signs claiming the coldest
beer in the Barony.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1256/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
[**> PK <**] >>
s
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1255/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
s
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1254/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1253/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>
s
op e
e
La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) (west) ]

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1252/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | La Rochelle Row (N[E][W])
>>
You open the door.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1252/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | La Rochelle Row (NE[W])
>>
Bell and Ball
  Much of this manor appears to be closed off for no particular purpose, though
the foyer is massive. The expansive area houses a large selection of 
embroidered carpets running along the outer edges of the room, its center a 
smooth and polished wooden dancefloor. At all times of day, dignitaries can 
be seen moving in and out, drinking their fine wines, wearing their fine 
clothes, and dancing to fine music. A chalice rests at the northwestern side 
of the room, ever-overflowing into a large basin with a smooth and 
rich-smelling liquor from which the patrons of the manor ladle into their 
goblets.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
     (Magic) An Everlasting Chalice rests in the corner of the room, spilling wine.
(Red Aura) A man in finery schmoozes with the guests.
(Red Aura) One of Fellchantry's serving girls slips between dancing couples with a platter of
beverages.
(Red Aura) A picture of elegance and grace, this woman is twirled by her dance partner.

Lv 165  G 142556 | Bell and Ball (W)

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1249/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | La Rochelle Row (NES)
>>
Wine and Sorcery
  Tucked away behind the decadence of plastered walls and powdered silks lies a 
structure which one might have surmised would be a temple. Alas, despite the 
grand pillars, polished frescoes and vaulted ceilings the interior of this 
seemingly holy place has been adorned with varnished tables of deep oak and 
chairs reclined in cushions and teak. The air is ever-thickened and blue with
smoke, carrying naught but the melodic laughter and posh ramblings of those 
who could call themselves nobility within the Barony.
 
Placed firmly at the western exit is a single door of heavy and treated
wood, its engravings depicting many abstract concepts causing the average
set of eyes to cross if looked at too closely.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
     Tables and cushioned seats are laid out about the area.
(Golden Aura) A gentryman enjoys a drink over a platter of seafood.
(Red Aura) A smirking merchant discusses business with the gentlefolk.
(Invis) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) A gentryman enjoys a drink over a platter of
seafood.
A strapping man serves complex cocktails.

4554/5127 HP  5227/5569 MP  1248/1261 mv  483tnl

marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

4590/5127 HP  5332/5569 MP  1260/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | La Rochelle Row (NES)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

4590/5127 HP  5332/5569 MP  1259/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.

4590/5127 HP  5332/5569 MP  1258/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
e
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.

4590/5127 HP  5332/5569 MP  1257/1261 mv  483tnl  
Lv 165  G 142556 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
